page.title: 03Nortonbury
page.content: Nortonbury is a small hamlet NE of Norton village comprising a few dwellings,a mill and a farm.Nortonbury farm is owned by the Letchworth Garden City Corp.They have owned it for ten years.The farm house is now let to the scouts and guides.Some of the buildings are not used anymore.The cattle shed is used as stables but the grain store is still used for grain. It is hoped that in the future there will be a craft centre in some of the other out buildings.The land is used for crops,such as wheat,barley,oats, beans,peas and grazing land for the horses.Barley is planted in the Spring.It has a lower yield than wheat which is ploughed in the Autumn.Barley is harvested first.They get a yield of three to three and a half tons of wheat and two to two and a half tons of barley per acre.
